name: Doubletree by Hilton Ocean Point Resort & Spa - North Miami Beach

reviews.text: Let me preface this review with the following comment, I write many reviews, some for lower priced accomodation and some for higher. I am always fair in relation to the value for money you receive.
reviews.title: Rarely been so disappointed value for money wise

reviews.text: This is the worst value for money for any hotel I have visited and left a very bad taste in the mouth for the entire stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful family vacation spot

reviews.text: This place does not have the staffing levels you would expect for a hotel and is more of a bunch of serviced apartments. The building itself is very dated and in need of a significant overhaul. From start to finish of our stay the staff we unhelpful and unfriendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: First point - the entrance to the hotel is on the equivalent of the 5th floor (you drive up a steep slope), which is OK if you drive up to it but if you want to walk down to the street you have to go down a staircase the whole way which is a treck, we could find no direct access to the road (there is on for the beach).
reviews.title: Great for Small Families

reviews.text: The entrance is very small and a complete zoo with cars coming and going at all times. Beware relying on the hotel for taxis, you are far better walking down to the street and getting one yourself.
reviews.title: Customer service good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a long weekend here (4 nights) in February 2013. We spent most of our time at the hotel and really only left for dinner. As hhonors gold members, we were given "gold" bracelets and an upgrade to a suite on the top floor. As a gold member, I have been given upgrades to nicer rooms, but this was over the top. The room had a full kitchen - including dishwasher, washer and drier directly outside, a jacuzzi tub, two large rooms, and a large balcony. There were also chocolates waiting for us along with water, compliments of the management. The bracelets allowed us to get 25% off of food and drinks while we were there. I believe that it also applied to the spa as well, but I didn't have a spa treatment, so I can't say for sure. I did get a good look at the spa facilities as I showered there on the last day because our flight didn't leave until 6pm. The spa and workout facilities are beautiful!
reviews.title: It's hard to find complaints with the beach.

reviews.text: There were a few things that I think should be noted as out of the ordinary - not bad.
reviews.title: Nice hotel on the beach.

reviews.text: 1 - and this is a pretty big deal - THERE IS AN AUTOMATIC SERVICE CHARGE ADDED ON ALL FOOD/DRINK. Miami gets visitors from all walks of life and from all places in the world. American businesses generally pay their servers less figuring on added income from tips. Other places in the world do not work this way. When a small hotel is serving clientele from everywhere, there is no guarantee that the waiter/waitress will get a tip. This is just them taking care of their people. EVERY other place that we went to in Miami Beach worked this way. If it were only at the hotel, I might be shocked. The servers also reminded me that there was a charge being added on. I imagine that they may get complaints.
reviews.title: Great night, post cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 - chairs on the beach were $12 each. It was extra to get an umbrella or a cabana to shade you from the sun. This is pretty standard all along Miami Beach (in fact, it's twice as much in South Beach), but in case you weren't expecting it, it might shock you. The pool chairs were free, although hard to come by if you weren't there at 8am to throw your towel on one. (I will NEVER understand this practice.)
reviews.title: Mixed reactions, but generally pleased

reviews.text: 3 - The room wasn't in the most amazing shape. There was a little wear and tear on the walls and carpet, but it wasn't dirty. Properties on the beach are hard to keep up because of all of the salt. It seemed a little old, but everything was comfortable and safe and clean which matters more than a small mark on the wall where someone accidentally bumped their suitcase.
reviews.title: At least on the beach

reviews.text: This is a hotel/condo property. Some units are rented directly through Doubletree whilhe others can be obtained from Homeaway or other such websites. Look for ones listed by Michael. He is on-site and that's a comfort knowing he is close by should something go wrong.
reviews.title: Calm & Relaxing - NOT SOBE

reviews.text: The unit we stayed in was a 1-bedroom, seperate living room and bathroom and large closet with a safe. Great views of the ocean and intercostal. Nice table to sit outside and enjoy something to eat or drink. . We choose this area bc of the selection of beach front hotels vs Miami. I wanted to be able to walk out and be on the beach and have a balcony with a view. The doubeltree fit the bill on both. Also all units have kitchette and ours even had a washer/dryer. Plus I didn't want the party scene of SOBE although going down for an evening nice.
reviews.title: Good value for Miami Beach
know what to expect
reviews.text: We went through Homeway and got a great deal on a 1-bedroom for about $160 a night that included in and out valet parking. Hotel guest are charged around $27 a day for this privllege.

The hotel is in a good location. Starbucks, grocery stores, liquor, pharmacy all within walking distant. There is a gourmet market called Epicure about a block south of the property that has great baked goods and high end items (little pricey) but the danish are the size of your head lol. In the next shopping center is a really good cuban place called EL Tropico. I highly recommend both of these.
reviews.title: Amazing family trip at this wonderful hotel.

reviews.text: Beach is very nice. Sand clean, water perfect. Especially nice if your looking for that "caribbean" blue but don't have the time to get down to the islands this area makes for a really nice long weekend getaway. Fly into Ft Lauderdale its a bit closer and less hectic than coming up from Miami.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better mini-vacation

reviews.text: This is now my third stay in the Oceanpoint. I am sure there are far better options, but I like the place. It gives me enough anonymity yet also feel welcome. It has a prime beach location, a small but decent pool and some jacuzzi-ish pools around the main pool. I can see that at busy tourist times the place can get crowded and staff might have difficulties satisfying guests, because the place aroudn the pool gets cramped - but then again, there's a beach which is large enough for everyone.
reviews.title: Good and solid place

reviews.text: The hotel does need some improvements on some issues. I also saw wallpaper in the bathroom peeling off, which looked a bit cheap and dirty. The bathrooms of the suites are certainly not the best and are below the standard of the hotel. I had a bathroom with a large jacuzzi which did not make sense. I don't need a jacuzzi which takes ages (really) to fill and the sound sof the jacuzzi will certainly wake up the whole floor. The jacuzzi was not an added value but rather a nuisance. That can't be right. Also the kithchen, though large and with all amenities, is dated.
reviews.title: Disappointed.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having previously stayed at the Ocean Point Resort a couple of years ago, I was expecting another wonderful experience, but that is not what we received. Our suite was in dire need of attention and the physical quality of the suite was severly lacking. Phone and ice maker were broken, towel and toilet paper holders were propped up and fell at the slightest touch, shower doors were off track and wouldn't close, shoddy repairs to the bathroom walls, tacks/staples sticking out of the living room chair, old and run down furniture, and a malfunctioning cooling/heating unit made me embarrassed in justifying the rate we paid to those traveling with me. I expected so much more and was completely disappointed.
reviews.title: Oceanview rooms

reviews.text: Awesome hotel with nice, spacious and clean rooms with washer, dryer and good sized kitchen. The view from partial ocean view rooms is great , you can sit in the balcony and look at the ocean. Warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in and the breakfast buffet is decent. Complimentary towels and you can just walk down to the beach from the pool area..
reviews.title: Go elsewhere

reviews.text: Let's see.... The closet door was off the track. I nearly clobbered myself opening it. The sink was split. The two pictures on the wall were half-obscured by the TV (rehang them?). The balcony door was impossible to open and the balcony furniture was dirty, old and mismatched. The air conditioning rattled. The restaurant looked like a high school cafeteria. The gym was behind the hair salon. The ladies locker room was a mess. But best of all, there is a hotel going up next door and, even if I could have opened the balcony door, the noise , which started at 7 a m and did not cease until 6 p m, would have drowned out the ocean waves. Chris, in the restaurant, was a lovely man, and seemed to be the only staff person who cared about the patrons.
reviews.title: Needs an update

reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels my husband is a diamond member who spends a lot with the Hilton group annually. This hotel is not a Hilton rather more of a Holiday Inn charging Four Seasons rates. We are currently stuck in a disgusting 1 bdrm king suite it is rundown moldy corners peeling walls 1980s decor. It smells so bad in here. The shower is handicap accessible so it has a electric seat and no enclosure. - we are not handicapped nor did we request such a room. The lobby of the hotel is also rundown.
reviews.title: Stay away cheap!

reviews.text: To sum up don't stay here save your money this place is garbage with so many beautiful hotels to choose from within the same price range this should not be where you stay this is what I expect from a Holiday Inn or best western not a Hilton.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there a few weeks ago and absolutely loved the hotel. Very beautiful hotel and staff was super friendly. Our room was actually and like a one room condo. It would be perfect for a family vacation with kids. The location on the beach couldn't have been any better as well!!!!!!!
reviews.title: our time

reviews.text: first time in years we have been on holiday without the kids.
reviews.title: Do not stay there-get out

reviews.text: we booked the doubletree for a pre cruise stay we chose it for its location & its pool / veiw & i must say we were not disapointed, we only had 2 nights we wish we had more , as they say we will be back.
reviews.title: “Rarely been so disappointed value for money wise - 2"

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I finished a cruise and randomly walked in on a Friday afternoon looking for a room. The front desk was very sweet and found us a room with a ocean view and city view. They gave us a warm cookie at check in too. Then we went to the pool bar and had some drinks with a friendly bartender. The hotel had a nice pool. In the room there was a mini frige big enough for beer and wine along with a microwave. The bathroom was lavishly huge and I loved the soaps and shampoo. I would highly suggest this place.
reviews.title: For the price, luxury at it's best
Doubletree
reviews.text: We arrived early this morning after a short cruise, we were greeted warmly and check-in was painless, room was ready. Excellent views of beach, great service by pleasant staff. Room could use some updating, hallways have a worn look, but overall a great property in an excellent location. Looking for dinner? Go across the street and down two blocks to Timos, wonderfull!!!
The room we had, was huge, kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, living area! Hard to find this much space anywhere for the price and location. Will be back!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Place for a Holiday

reviews.text: Great hotel on the beach with a great beach. Restaurant was adequate but lots to eat in the area. This is the perfect beach hotel in the Miami area. Store and snack are on premises, bar by the pool, full kitchen in the x02 rooms.
reviews.title: Great views, great location and great beach

reviews.text: We opted for the one bedroom room. This was originally built as a condo so it's a full apartment with kitchen, washer / dryer and full balcony with ocean and city views. Across the street is everything: grocery, drugstore, restaurants and Starbucks. Great place on the beach for our family.
reviews.title: somewhat run-down Doubletree right on the water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Words can't describe the fantastic weekend we had at the Doubletree Ocean Point! We were greeted at the front desk by the nicest lady, Jennifer James and were so excited to find out that our Hilton Honors Gold upgrade was available! Jennifer then explained all of our benefits for the long weekend. What a wonderful way to start our vacation by having a lovely reception at the front desk! Thank you Jennifer!
reviews.title: Doubletree Ocean Point Resort & Spa is SUPERB!

reviews.text: The suite was more than we could have asked for! Full kitchen with washer/dryer, extra large living area, and a bed that was so very comfortable! The views from the extra large balcony were spectacular! We loved being able to cook in the comfort of our suite! The pool and beach were awesome!
reviews.title: Clean, efficient and great location

reviews.text: I wish I could think of someway they could improve, but for me and my husband, the Doubletree Ocean Point is our home away from home in Miami! The only problem is deciding when we can return!
reviews.title: Nice Place thats needs a few updates.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Doubletree for 5 nights in May in a twin room. 2 double beds. Large room and bathroom. Old box TV. Fridge and microwave and kitchen sink. Washing machine and dryer outside of room and shared with one other room. Comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ask for a room on the North side. As the hotel does not run along the beach, but down from the beach, all the rooms have ocean views. However, if you are facing North you don't have any buildings infront of you. South facing rooms face onto another building.
reviews.title: 5 Star Location, Room Size & Ammenties. 2-3 Star Front Desk Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside bar: The service at the outside bar was great. Her name was Sheila and she was very friendly.
reviews.title: Beach fees will cost you...

reviews.text: My family stayed in a very spacious two bedroom two bath suite with a kitchen. While the space and view was very nice, I found the room in need of major renovation. I'm not talking about replacing the furniture (a note was left on the dining table that the furniture in the suites was being replaced over the next month) but overall repairs. The window in the kitchen was broken and would not open. All sliding doors needed work on the tracks. I had to push with all the strength I had to get them to open. The bathrooms had stained wallpaper that was peeling and some sections had been torn off. The carpet had so many buckles that you had to look down to make sure you didn't trip. I found the kitchen minimally stocked with pots/pans and all the handles had to be wiped off the cabinets, toaster, etc because they were sticky. The cabinet doors under the bathroom sink would not close and were falling off. All the paint throughout the suite was stained and looked like the original that was never redone. While our room on the 25th floor was large for the price, these updates, repairs and overall cleanliness need to be addressed.
reviews.title: Amazing view but needs a LOT of work!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree as our last stop on a road trip vacation with friends. The hotel is beautiful, the views from the rooms are fantastic. It sits right on the beach and you can use the hotel chairs and towels when you walk right off the back deck to the sand. The hot tub was wonderful to relax in as well. We love the service that Doubletree provides, with USA Today deliveries and cookies at check in. The beds are comfy and the room was spacious.
reviews.title: Wonderful beachfront hotel

reviews.text: We didn't try it, but the hotel offers a bar, spa, gift shop, and lounge that looked wonderful. The only complaints I have are that you are required to valet park and it is about $30, and that they charge for internet access.
reviews.title: Incredible Service, Nice Views, Rooms need some maintenance
pleasantly suprise, wonderful experience
reviews.text: We vacationed at the Doubletree after a 7 days cruise. We were looking for something a little more quiet and roomy. We rented 2 suites one a two bedroom suite for our family of 4 and a one bedroom suite for my parents. The rooms were very roomy and had plenty of extra space. Both had incredible ocean views. The two bedroom suite had an enormous deck. It wrapped all the way from the master bedroom to the extra room, giving us both a view of the ocean and of the city. There were lounge chairs on the desk and a table which we ate dinner at one night while watching the sunset. The only downside with the rooms is that they need a little maintenance. They are getting a little outdated and the walls, curtains and bathrooms could use some fixing up. That being said overall the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Service was incredible. Every staff member that we interacted with went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. They have this program called "catch me at my best" and we put in cards for several staff members. We have pretty high standards for our vacation rooms so I would give this hotel a 3+. The only issue holding them from a 5 is the fact that the rooms need some re-modeling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly suprised on how wonderful the accomodations, service and overall experience was for myself and my family at the doubletree. I did online research prior to booking the hotel and after reading the reviews I thought it sounded like a great place and it really was. we stayed in a two bedroom, 2 bath suite/condo oceanfront and it was definitely more than enough space for 3 adults and 2 small children. Some of the furniture/decor is just a little dated, but very clean and comfortable overall. The pool and beach access was amazing. The pool was especially excellent for young kids, it has a walk in very shallow end that the kids can just hang out in and be safe with supervision. If i could try and find any negatives it would only be the expense 26.00/day for valet parking (kind of steep to me/us) and the expense to rent beach equipment (10.00/chair, 15.00/umbrella). All staff we came across were very pleasant and helpful. overall, great experience and definitely would return.
reviews.title: Spacious suite, gorgeous view, on the ocean, well equipped, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Doubletree to be at my son's wedding in Miami.
reviews.title: Lovely room if you can actually get in and out of the hotel

reviews.text: I am in a wheelchair and enquired beforehand as to whether the hotel was wheelchair friendly and had adapted rooms.
reviews.title: Very Impressed with this hotel

reviews.text: As soon as we arrived we knew there would be problems, the hotel (like many on Collins Avenue) stand elevated at the top of steep driveways.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, bad timing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely a one bedroom suite with adapted bathroom having a seat in the shower with grab rails and grab rails at the toilet. Large bedroom, lounge and kitchen with all the appliances.
reviews.title: Extremely noisy all night long!

reviews.text: Good beach but thought that $35 + tax and gratuity for 2 beds and parasol was extremely expensive especially when similar hotels did not charge at all.
reviews.title: Love the location, excellent service & right on the beach!

aka: Doubletree Ocean Point Resort & Spa - Miami Beach North Hotel
